comments:
1. create a new html file
2. insert the html template
3. Save.
4. cleanup document and make all tags/attributes uppercase
5. everything looks ok
6. close the file and reopen
7. cleanup document and make all tags/attributes uppercase
8. only the first 3 start tags are made uppercase
9. try cleanup again, and you get the below error

*** Bug 105349 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

In RC3 with just the HTML transitional template contents, setting the cleanup
dialog to only alter the tag or attribute name case results in no changes.

In 0.7.0, "alter the tag or attribute name case" effects zero, because
HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl fails to overwrite/extend inherited function
getCleanupPreferences(). CleanupProcessorXML (the class from which
HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl is derived) doesn't know "alter the tag or attribute
name case". I solved that in my installation, but I see in webCVS that
HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl.java has experienced major changes, so my patch isn't
needed anymore/won't do any good.

i no longer see the original bug
and in regards to comment #2 and comment #3
bug 104562 fixed the problem.
